head.title: New TV Season in Review; Close Encounters Of the Supernatural Kind

hedline.hl1: New TV Season in Review; Close Encounters Of the Supernatural Kind

abstract.p: Ron Wertheimer reviews Freakylinks, new series based on supernatural on Fox Television (S)

block.p: ''Somebody's messing with my head,'' declares Derek Barnes (Ethan Embry), the earnest hero of ''Freakylinks.'' After a few minutes of this supernatural stew you'll know exactly how he feels. The show's overambitious purveyors are messing with your head, trying to cram 50 pounds of ideas into their 10-pound pilot with subjects like lost love, lost chances and the lost Roanoke Colony.

''Somebody's messing with my head,'' declares Derek Barnes (Ethan Embry), the earnest hero of ''Freakylinks.'' After a few minutes of this supernatural stew you'll know exactly how he feels. The show's overambitious purveyors are messing with your head, trying to cram 50 pounds of ideas into their 10-pound pilot with subjects like lost love, lost chances and the lost Roanoke Colony.

Derek runs a Web site that investigates unexplained phenomena. The work is his memorial to his twin brother, Adam. Derek's single-trait colleagues are the brainy Lan (Lizette Carrion) and the comical Jason (Karim Prince). When an e-mail from beyond suggests that Adam may not be really most sincerely dead, Derek enlists Adam's former fiancee, the spunky Chloe (Lisa Sheridan), in the hunt for answers. This leads them to the lunatic Elsing (Dennis Christopher), who declares, ''They'll be coming soon.'' Maybe not soon enough.
